channel.title: NYT > Week in Review
channel.description: Find news, essays and opinion on politics, the President of the United States, international relations, new trends & ideas, the public editor and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2005 The New York Times Company

item.title: The World: A Little Democracy or a Genie Unbottled
item.description: Free and fair elections in the Middle East have unleashed political forces that can hardly be seen as friendly to the United States.
item.author: JAMES GLANZ

item.title: Ex-Ex-Ex-Men: The Remarrying Kind
item.description: Why do the ultrarich marry, and re-marry, and re-marry?
item.author: KATE ZERNIKE

item.title: The Nation: Putting the Motor City Back in Gear
item.description: Whether retreat or rout, what can be done to reverse the fortunes of Detroit's Big Three? Five auto industry analysts tried to answer that question.
item.author: PETER EDIDIN

item.title: Ideas & Trends: Benedict: A Man of His Words
item.description: Are words enough in a papacy? Do the words themselves constitute a plan? Is it simply still too early to judge the reign of Pope Benedict XVI?
item.author: IAN FISHER

item.title: Ideas & Trends: Talk to the Rock, and Other Spy Tricks
item.description: In our digital age, isn't there something anachronistic about spies who sneak into the woods to service their pet rocks?
item.author: SCOTT SHANE

item.title: Laugh Lines: Jay Leno, David Letterman and Jon Stewart
The Nation: The New Corporate Outsourcing
item.description: Over time, Big Business has learned how to love Big Government. Or at least some of it.
item.author: CLIFFORD J. LEVY

item.title: Correspondence | The Endless Boot Camp: Playing Den Mother to a Fledgling Iraqi Army
item.description: The pace of an eventual withdrawal of more than 140,000 American troops depends on the training of the Iraq Army.
item.author: ROGER COHEN

item.title: The Basics: How to Outwit the World's Internet Censors
item.description: The Chinese government is unmatched in its ability to censor and monitor its citizens online. Of course, no system is perfect.
item.author: TOM ZELLER Jr.

item.title: The Basics: A New Leader in Canada Means...
item.description: How much of a difference will the change in government make to the United States? Probably, not a whole lot.
item.author: CLIFFORD KRAUSS

item.title: Reading File: Pitching Values to Democrats as a Way to Win
item.author: THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: Reading File: God Save Amadeus
item.description: Stephen Brown, writing in The Times Literary Supplement in London, compared Mozart to a Sex Pistol.
item.author: THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: The World: How Hamas Rose From Wild Card to Power
item.description: From the start, Hamas has been a wild card in the Palestinian-Israeli conflict.
item.author: JOHN KIFNER

item.title: The World: Guess Who Likes the G.I.'s in Iraq (Look in Iran's Halls of Power)
item.description: In conversations about the nuclear showdown with the U.S. and Europe, Iranian officials cite the Iraq war as a factor Iran can play to its own advantage.
item.author: MICHAEL SLACKMAN
